front.title: Dynamic Network Adjustments for Cloud Service Scaling

abstract.t: This document defines a framework for dynamically adjusting network- wide load balancing policies in response to cloud service scaling events, addressing key challenges faced by Telecom Cloud Service Providers (TCSPs). As cloud services scale, increase traffic, or relocate workloads across distributed edge and core clouds, network policies must adapt in real time to maintain optimal performance and ensure compliance with strict service level objectives (SLOs). Current manual network adjustments are often slow, error prone, and insufficient for the dynamic nature of cloud environments.
